description.narrative: The Objectives of the Project are (a) enhanced quality, efficiency and relevance of higher education through a set of systemic reforms, and incentives to selected institutions; and (b) improved access for academically qualified students from disadvantaged groups in (i) higher education and (ii) higher secondary education.

condition.narrative: The Recipient shall establish the Quality Assurance and Accreditation Council as a body independent of UGC and with functions andst affing satisfactory to the Association
The Recipient shall furnish to Association trimester interim unaudited financial reports not later than 45 days after the end oftri mester
The Recipient shall take all necessary measures to ensure that UGC earmark grants to Autonomous Campuses within grants to TUstartin g from FY08/09
The Recipient will appoint by December 31, 2007, and there after maintain, an Administrator for SFAFDB with qualifications andterms of reference satisfactory to the Association
The Recipient, not later than October 15, 2008, shall cause schools receiving grants to maintain records, and communitiesbenefiting from the school to undertake annual social audits
The recipient shall furnish to the Association audited financial statements for a fiscal year not later than six months after thee nd of the fiscal year

title.narrative: Student pass rates at masters levels in participating institutions

comment.narrative: Figures from 2008/09 exam results
Average pass rate of 2011/12

title.narrative: Student pass rates at bachelors levels in participating institutions

comment.narrative: Figures from 2008/09 exam results
Will not meet the target. Lower rate due to very rapid expansion of HE system and highly centralized examinations

title.narrative: Share of enrollment from dalits and educationally disadvantaged Janajatis in participating higher education institutions

comment.narrative: Figures from 2009/10 enrollment
Target exceeded.

title.narrative: Share of students enrolled in science, technology, management, and other employment/economic development focused programs in participating higher education institutions

comment.narrative: Figures from 2009/10 enrollment
The figure also includes (a) 1,589 students enrolled in the new window programs and (b) 3,177 students enrolled in the recentlytransformed to the semester system of TU central departments

title.narrative: Share of girls enrollment in participating higher education institutions

comment.narrative: Figures from 2009/10 enrollment
Target exceeded.

title.narrative: Share of enrollment from dalits and educationally disadvantaged Janajatis in participating higher secondary schools

comment.narrative: Figures from 2009/10 enrollment
Original target: Dalits:5%;Disadvantaged janajatis: 8%.
Target exceeded. The current figures are based on the latest DOE EMIS data (Flash I 2013-14), where highly marginalized janajatisare not reported.

title.narrative: Total enrollment in participating higher education institutions

comment.narrative: HE data refers to participating institutions as of 2009/2010 (47 community campuses, 10 TU constituent campuses & 3 smalluniversities
Target exceeded. Enrollment in 47 community campuses (Scheme A, B and C), 10 TU decentralized campuses, and 3 universities as inthe baseline data.

title.narrative: Share of girls enrollment in participating higher secondary schools

comment.narrative: Initial baseline, which was calculated from total enrollment in CHSSs. Girls average share in total (above figures) was equivalentto that of participating schools
Not less than 50%. The original target was 43%.
Target reached and maintained.

title.narrative: Number of publications in refereed journals by the research grant recipients in approved research areas

comment.narrative: New indicator
Additional 45 have been published in professional journals, 6 have been presented in international conferences. Other publicationsare in pipeline.

title.narrative: Admissions, exams, and publication of exam results at TU follow published calendar

comment.narrative: New indicator
Share (%) of TU centrally run programs that followed academic calendar. Some improvements observed because of the semester systemTU has started at the Central Department

title.narrative: Number of new programs in science, technology, management, and other employment/economic development focused programs in participating institutions

comment.narrative: New indicator
Target exceeded. 31 Central Departments of TU have started 38 Master programs in semester system – features of these programs aresimilar to window programs.

title.narrative: Autonomy packages for Decentralized Campuses developed by TU

comment.narrative: New indicator

title.narrative: Comprehensive higher education policy developed and adopted by government

comment.narrative: New indicator
GON approval awaited

title.narrative: Share of enrollment in the science stream in participating community higher secondary schools

comment.narrative: New indicator. These figures are from 2009/10 enrollment data
Target met. Based on exam appeared data, share of science students enrollment at Higher Secondary level in total is around 14%,based on pass rate, the figure is around 22%.
Project effective from July 27, 2007 facilitated the establishment of an Accreditation system in Nepal
Target exceeded.

title.narrative: Total enrollment in participating higher secondary schools

comment.narrative: Total enrollment in community higher secondary schools (CHSSs)
Target revised in the MTR.
Target exceeded. This figure is based on the latest DOE EMIS data (Flash I, 2013-14).

title.narrative: Number of community campuses getting project support

comment.narrative: Original EOP target was 10. Target was revised due to high demand when the project was restructured in March 2011.
One campus dropped as it could not meet the criteria.
Original target of 6 was reduced to 3 when the project was restructured in March 2011.
Revised target met.

title.narrative: Number of students receiving financial assistance from the Fund at Higher Education level

comment.narrative: Target exceeded.

title.narrative: Number of students receiving financial assistance from the Fund at Higher Secondary Education level

comment.narrative: Target exceeded.
Original target of 48 was reduced to 45 when the project was restructured in March 2011.
Target met. This includes 4 autonomous campuses that completed the decentralization as a requirement for opting autonomy.

title.narrative: Enrollment in community higher secondary schools

comment.narrative: Target revised from 68000 in the MTR
Target exceeded. These figures are from MOE/DOE latest EMIS (Flash I, 2013/14).

title.narrative: Quality Assurance and Accreditation System functional

comment.narrative: QAA system within UGC is functional. UGC has submitted concept paper and draft Bill to MOE for the establishment of an independentNational Accreditation Board.

title.narrative: Publication of EMIS reports based on functioning EMIS software/database with campus-level data

comment.narrative: Sixth issue of EMIS Report published in May 2014; web-based Report of the same issue is also ready for publication.
